Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all hardware devices. Each device can have a name and is part of a device category.
See also:
DeviceManager.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbstractDevice::Category
 

Each device is part of a category. The category describes the purpose of the device. Several instances of devices for one category might exist. The categories can be extended by using values > 100 (see AbstractDevice::GetCategory)

Enumerator:
DisplayCategory 
StillCameraCategory 
VideoCameraCategory 
KeyboardCategory 
LedCategory 
ChargerCategory 
RealTimeClockCategory 
CodecCategory 
CustomCategory 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AbstractDevice::AbstractDevice (  INT  category = CustomCategory,
INT  index = 0
)  [explicit]
 

Parameters:
category Category of the device (see AbstractDevice::Category). Custom values can be defined, but the values 0 - 100 are reserved for APOXI.
index Index of the device in relation to the category. One device category can have a variable number of devices. The device category and the device index are a unique key for getting a device instance.

AbstractDevice::~AbstractDevice (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

ControlArg AbstractDevice::Control (  INT  command,
ControlArg  arg
) 
 

Generic interface for additional functionality. This method is never called and should be considered as a template for derived Devices.

Parameters:
command ID for commands
arg user defined argument
Returns:
user defined return value

INT AbstractDevice::GetCategory (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the category of the device (see AbstractDevice::Category). One category can have more than one instance of a device. Per default CustomCategory is returned.

See also:
AbstractDevice::GetIndex

INT AbstractDevice::GetIndex (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the index of the device in relation to the category. One device category can have a variable number of devices. The device category and the device index are a unique key for getting a device instance. Per default 0 is returned.

virtual const WCHAR* AbstractDevice::GetName (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the name of a device. The name must not be unique and should just give a short description of the device.

Implemented in Audio, Audio, Audio, Audio, Audio, DefaultDisplay, VirtualDisplay, Charger, Fota, Keyboard, Led, BackLight, DefaultDisplay, VirtualDisplay, BackLight, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, VirtualDisplay, RealTimeClock, BackLight, DefaultDisplay, VirtualDisplay, StillCamera, VideoCamera, AmplifierAudioDevice, DefaultDisplay, GenericAudioDevice, KeyToneAudioDevice, MiscAudioDevice, Mp3AudioDevice, RingerAudioDevice, SpeechAudioDevice, ToneAudioDevice, VirtualDisplay, and VoiceMemoAudioDevice.

void AbstractDevice::OnStart (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the DeviceManager when the system is started. The device must attach itself to the DeviceManager by invoking DeviceManager::AddDevice(*this) in its constructor.

Reimplemented in Charger, DefaultDisplay, Keyboard, Led, RealTimeClock, Charger, DefaultDisplay, Keyboard, Led, RealTimeClock, Charger, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, Keyboard, Led, RealTimeClock, Charger, DefaultDisplay, Keyboard, Led, RealTimeClock, Charger, DefaultDisplay, Led, and RealTimeClock.

void AbstractDevice::OnStop (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked by the DeviceManager when the system is shut down. It is recommended that the device removes itself from the DeviceManager by invoking DeviceManager::RemoveDevice(*this) in its destructor.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, RealTimeClock, DefaultDisplay, RealTimeClock, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, RealTimeClock, DefaultDisplay, RealTimeClock, DefaultDisplay, and RealTimeClock.
